titles.title: Worker Eligibility Fairness Act of 2009
To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to remove the ineligibility of individuals who participate in a strike.
Worker Eligibility Fairness Act of 2009

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: Worker Eligibility Fairness Act of 2009 - Amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to eliminate the provision making a federal, state, or local government employee who is dismissed for participating in a strike against the federal government, the state, or a political subdivision of the state ineligible for the supplemental nutrition assistance program (formerly the food stamp program).
